pros: Davidson College lives up to its mission of "developing humane instincts, and disciplined and creative minds, for lives of leadership and service. Faculty and staff love the students, and the students inspire us in turn.

review_title: Phenomenal people, campus, and community—limited pay and opportunity for promotion/advancement
pros: Access to campus amenities (gym, library, lake campus, etc.); genuinely friendly and caring community; ample paid holiday, vacation, and sick days; excellent retirement match (8.5%, up to 9.5%); decent insurance options; little to no micromanagement; you're surrounded by brilliant and accomplished minds!
cons: Pay is well below market rate; very easy to get "stuck" (I've been working here four years, undergone three title changes with increasing responsibility, and never received a raise beyond the annual $0.50/hour); like academia everywhere, change occurs at a glacial pace if at all; often feels like concerns/complaints/recommendations for change fall on deaf ears

cons: Bureaucratic, not transparent in decision processes

pros: Friendly employee culture. Staff are genuinely concerned for one another and we get to work with awesome students. Campus is beautiful, and we have access to amenities like free gyms and the lake campus. Retirement benefits are competitive. The college puts 10% of your salary into retirement if you put in 1%, and you're vested after 3 years. The college has a strong history of allowing staff to move to new positions in other departments/offices, and phased retirement is a regular practice here. The college also helps pay for your kids' college educations if you've been here a certain number of years.
cons: When people leave Davidson, they leave Davidson for financial reasons. The salaries are not competitive, and medical benefits are meh and prices are rising. The college recently began a new yearly budgeting process that requires every department to shave off 7% of its annual budget to be "reallocated." The process is even less transparent than it was before, and employees are generally displeased as it appears that the reallocations go to pet projects. Staff are legendarily regarded as second-class compared to faculty, and unfortunately there are many situations in which this is made painfully clear to staff.

pros: Great students and campus culture/environment
cons: can be a bit slow-paced

pros: I am a Student at Davidson College
cons: No cons at the moment

pros:
-Typically a fun group of people to work with
-Pay is good for the amount of hours you end up working
-Affords opportunities for leadership and mentoring other students
cons:
-Poor work/life balance - unreasonable time demands for a college student
-The office is fixated on pushing a political agenda on students and expects you to do this as part of your job
-Too much focus on relatively insignificant aspects of the job that take up a good deal of time (e.g., door decorations, hall programming that is typically poorly attended)
-Not enough focus on improving safety for residents
-Pay is well below that of Resident Assistant positions at other institutions (other schools typically waive a RA's entire room and board, Davidson RLO only waives half)

pros: Smart and collaborative colleagues. Good career growth opportunities. Great administration.  Excellent job security. Amazing campus with lots of community engagement opportunities.  Good pay, great benefits.  There are lots of social opportunities to bond with colleagues.  It feels like a family.  Best culture/values of anywhere that I have worked.
cons: The commute on I-77.  Like any large organization there is some bureaucracy that slows down the decision making process.  There could be more processes put in place to recruit and develop talent on the staff side.

pros: The fellows program provides great opportunities for recent graduates to work in various departments of the College. The people I worked with were fantastic and really facilitated a team environment. Flexible hours. Great pay for a first job out of undergrad considering the responsibilities.
cons: The fellow positions are only for 2 years but depending on the department there may be opportunities to move up into a more permanent position. Depending on your personality it can be difficult to transition from student to staff member. Some in higher administration will still see you as a student and not give you the respect that they may give other employees. Thankfully in my case those instances were few.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: great hours and location.  Best summer job. I worked at the lake campus for 2 summers and it was an awesome experience. Baker Sports complex was a great location to work and all of the staff around the building were friendly and good to work with.
cons: Unless I wanted to be a lifeguard, the skills that I learned when I worked for the school are not transferable to really any other job.  I did not do this job because I thought it would help me with my future though.

review_title: Davidson College is an Unequal Opportunity Employer.
pros: If you are a Davidson College graduate and you stick around to work there, it is a candy job.  What they don't realize is that these people have no "real life" experience to guide them and thus they operate out of a bubble.  In the end, they are extremely ineffective and self-serving.
cons: If you are not a Davidson College graduate, you will always be treated like sh*t.  You may actually rise to management, but you will never go beyond.  They pride themselves on never firing Davidson grads who work for the college, but the everyone else is expendable.

review_title: Davidson is a very supportive work environment with a flexible schedule and wonderful people!
pros: Davidson has a supportive work environment, friendly staff, intelligent, motivated students, good work/life balance, and the town of Davidson is completely idyllic.
cons: The salary level for fellows is low, and not particularly competitive with other entry-level positions. Some departments have opportunities to move into full-time positions, others do not.

review_title: Friendly environment, though a bit backward, stuck in their old ways, not open to advancing
job_title: Painting Department Supervisor/Foreman in Davidson, NC
pros: friendly employees, fair wages for a private college of its sizel but less than state college, relaxed and casual  work environment
cons: not open to changing or advancing in technology and new techniques, a bit back woods country mentality, generally lazy work attitudes breed complacency

job_title: Union Café Manager in Gastonia, NC
pros: Great benefits, great amount of time off and very family oriented.  Lots of cultural and fun things to do on campus and the students are wonderful.
cons: Not a whole lot of downside.  Pay is not really competitive with comparable jobs in regular industry, but the other benefits outweigh that tremendously.

pros: Fantastic people in the Anthropology Department of Davidson College, flexible work hours as long as work was completed in a reasonable time. Good pay.
cons: Worked alone in the basement of the academic building in a relatively closed off space. Not enough room to work with and not enough specimens to get any significant research done.

pros: Davidson definitely treats its employees like family.  Benefits are great, a strong community atmosphere across departments, and the town is a great place to live and work.
cons: Pay can be low, compared to comparable positions, but cost of living is also fairly low in the Davidson area.
